metadata.title: CVE-2023-40577 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Alertmanager handles alerts sent by client applications such as thePrometheus server. An attacker with the permission to perform POST requestson the /api/v1/alerts endpoint could be able to execute arbitraryJavaScript code on the users of Prometheus Alertmanager. This issue hasbeen fixed in Alertmanager version 0.2.51.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40577` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

prometheus-alertmanager - 0.6.2+ds-3ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: prometheus-alertmanager package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.2+ds-3ubuntu0.1+esm1').
